result.execSummary:
The defendant Garrett M Coyle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: to Court from Atty Frank
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Garrett M Coyle in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  15FO85 to be dismissed.  Atty Hendee will not be charging but will read-in an unrelated referral 15-SO2487 from July 22, 2015. Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.    Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  
Atty Frank makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold Sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
45 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before September 19, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Credit = 1 day if revoked

15FO85 to be dismissed.
15FO85 IS TRACKING W/15CM105
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 20, 2016 at 10:45 am.

Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the matter is resolved and parties are asking for a plea date.  Atty Frank agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/Sentencing
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Return date on June 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
